meanings.definition: To move from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The cat will locomote to the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent2: Birds locomote through the sky with ease.
meanings.sent3: The toy car decided to locomote across the room all by itself!
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to locomote endlessly towards the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The ants locomote in a straight line, following their leader.

meanings.sent1: We will locomote to the beach for our vacation.
meanings.sent2: Trains locomote across the country, carrying passengers and goods.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a flying car that can locomote through the air is fascinating.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to locomote to distant lands as she stared out the window.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship can locomote through space at incredible speeds.
